COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x14a
STRING: I finished my morning lesson, and lunch as well.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x156
STRING: Even so, neither Ms. Cordell nor Torta had said anything
about what happened yesterday.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x16c
STRING: Just like that, the day was going by me.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x178
STRING: Torta had something to attend to, so she'd left early,
and I was alone in the cafeteria wondering what to do
next.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x18e
STRING: There was some time left before the end of lunch, but
the one thing on my mind was Grave's lecture, and
whether I should attend it.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1ae
STRING: If only I hadn't seen how relieved Lise had been when
she heard I wasn't going to this lecture, I would've
attended it just to see what kind of person Grave was.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1ce
STRING: This was just conjecture on my part, but Lise probably
didn't want me to find out that her father wasn't, to put
it mildly, a very nice person.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1f8
STRING: And for that reason... Lise was ignored by everyone.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x20e
STRING: [Chris] “What to do, what to do...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x224
STRING: I remembered other days like this, of indecision in the
cafeteria.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x230
STRING: I'd even wandered the school buildings in search of a
partner.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x23c
STRING: That was how I'd met Lise, whom I was thinking of
choosing as my partner.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x252
STRING: And that's when I realized that I had nothing to worry
about.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x25e
STRING: I already knew about Lise.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x26a
STRING: It didn't matter what sort of person Grave was.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x276
STRING: But in that case, I should probably know more about
him.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x282
STRING: I stood up and looked at the clock.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x28e
STRING: The lecture was starting in five minutes.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x29a
STRING: If I hurried, I'd make it there with time to spare.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x2ee
STRING: Holding my breath, I entered the room to see another
student waiting silently in his seat.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x304
STRING: Grave was also seated near the lectern, reading some
scores.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x31a
STRING: There were three minutes left, so I took a seat near the
front, and breathed in deeply to calm myself.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x39e
STRING: [Grave] “Now then, today we shall see how well you
perform.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3b4
STRING: Without any warning, he cut straight to the chase.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3c0
STRING: That was his style, it seemed.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3d4
STRING: [Grave] “Both of you, prepare your Fortelles at a
suitable distance from each other.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x3f4
STRING: With that terse order, he took his place at the lectern.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x400
STRING: I had no idea what he meant by “a suitable distance,”
but in any case, I set up my Fortelle away from the
other student.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x416
STRING: We placed our chairs such that we were the same
distance from the nearest wall and each other, which
meant we were about four meters apart.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x436
STRING: I was seated beyond the front row of desks, so I was
quite close to Grave.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x454
STRING: [Grave] “Good. Now, you will both play for me, but you
may not play the same song twice. Do not forget that.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x47e
STRING: He continued, without giving us any time to respond.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x492
STRING: [Grave] “The Fortelle is fundamentally different from
other instruments that produce sound merely by the
touch of a key. Without magic, it wouldn't even make a
single sound.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x4c4
STRING: [Grave] “One does not play the Fortelle with one's
body, but with one's heart. Remember that. Through
rote practice, your fingers may learn to move on their
own, but now is not the time.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x4f6
STRING: [Grave] “And that is why you will keep playing new
songs for me. If a problem arises, I will provide
instruction. If you run out of songs to play, then the
lecture is over for you.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x528
STRING: [Grave] “I am well aware that you do not have many
songs to play. Make full use of your memory, and do
everything you can to benefit from this session.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x550
STRING: [Grave] “My expectations are not high. Even a lullaby
will do, or the very first song you learned. What matters
most is that you keep playing.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x57a
STRING: [Grave]

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x58c
STRING: “With your heart, of course.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x5a0
STRING: [Grave] “I do not mean that metaphorically, not at all.
Decipher the song's meaning, the composer's intent,
and express it accurately. Enough talk, let's begin.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x5ca
STRING: Grave spoke without pausing, and when he was done
he placed his chair in front of the lectern and sat down.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x5e8
STRING: [Grave] “What's the matter, the lecture has begun...
Shall I add another condition? If you stop playing for
more than ten seconds, you shall be deemed lacking in
purpose, and your time will be up.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x620
STRING: The other student and I looked at each other in
confusion.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x636
STRING: He'd told us at the start to sit apart, but at this distance,
there was no way we could focus on our own sound.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x64c
STRING: I decided to speak up.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x658
STRING: [Chris] “At this distance, we'd be distracted by each
other's playing, so may we have some time to reposition
ourselves?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x694
STRING: [Grave] “Stay where you are. As long as you
concentrate, it won't make any difference.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x6c2
STRING: He sounded irritated, as if he never intended to
entertain any opinions.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x6d8
STRING: He took up the score on the lectern and started reading
it.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x6ee
STRING: Having no other choice, I started playing the Fortelle.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x6fa
STRING: Perhaps what he'd said was right.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x706
STRING: His approach to the Fortelle and to music was
supported by the fact that he was a great musician.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x726
STRING: Nevertheless, there had to be a more pleasant way to
do things.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x732
STRING: Despite my resistance, I started playing an etude,
something really simple.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x748
STRING: Grave looked at me for just one second with something
like a smirk, before returning to his score.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x75e
STRING: Beside me, the other student launched straight into one
of the famous Fortelle showpieces.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x774
STRING: Given the contrast in our choices, for one moment, I
considered changing songs.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x780
STRING: But once I started a song, I couldn't switch halfway, so I
just had to keep playing.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x7b2
STRING: [Grave] “Stop playing.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x7ca
STRING: It wasn't a powerful voice, but it had the ability to make
people obey.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x7e0
STRING: Both of us stopped and looked at him.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x7f4
STRING: [Grave] “Chris Vertin, there was no need for you to stop.
Continue playing.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x822
STRING: Apparently, his initial order hadn't been directed at me.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x82e
STRING: As instructed, I played the etude once more from the
beginning.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x844
STRING: While I played, I tried to hear what he was saying.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x86c
STRING: [Grave] “I'll give you credit for starting with that piece.
But, do you intend to make a fool of the composer? I
told you to play with your heart.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x89e
STRING: [Grave] “I have no interest in seeing your fingering
technique.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x8d2
STRING: He had come to that judgment after listening to just a
few short bars.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x8e0
STRING: Then he turned to look at me, just once.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x8ec
STRING: He'd caught me looking, so I had no choice but to
return my gaze to the front.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x902
STRING: Even though I still felt some resistance, I was starting to
find this lecture slightly interesting.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x918
STRING: For my part, I just had to keep on playing.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x924
STRING: Somehow, that was the feeling I got.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x932
STRING: But come to think of it, could one really find intent in an
etude?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x948
STRING: Where was the composer's intent?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x954
STRING: I tried thinking about where it might be, but it just didn't
seem likely.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x968
STRING: The term etude suited a song that was written to show
differences in touch, or the basic action of hitting keys.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x97e
STRING: In short... All I had to do was stay true to those
fundamentals, right?

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x98a
STRING: With that thought, I reconsidered the meaning of the
composer's signs, and reproduced the intended actions.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x9a0
STRING: Instead of the overall flow of the music, I became
conscious of the importance of each rest note, the
dynamics and accuracy of each chord.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x9b6
STRING: As soon as one song ended, I summoned the next one
to mind, with barely any pause for breath.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x9ce
STRING: Glancing sideways, I saw that Grave had returned to his
seat and was ignoring me completely.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x9e4
STRING: Having no other choice, I selected the next song from
memory and started playing.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x9f0
STRING: It was another etude.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x9fc
STRING: The other student beside me also started playing an
etude.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xa12
STRING: Grave didn't move at all.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xa20
STRING: I recalled every symbol in the score perfectly as I
continued playing.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xa5c
STRING: About one hour had passed since we began.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xa68
STRING: I'd run out of simple songs, so I had to start playing
Fortelle pieces that were written with a vocal part.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xa7e
STRING: Ten seconds was a short time, and I had to start playing
whatever came to mind first.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xa96
STRING: The first thing I thought of was the song I always
practiced with Phorni.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xaa2
STRING: I was so familiar with it, my fingers began moving right
away.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xab8
STRING: It was a song I'd composed while reading one of Arie's
letters.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xace
STRING: It contained the feeling of making up for the distance
between us by writing letters.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xae6
STRING: Of course, there was no one to sing the vocal part.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xaf4
STRING: And so instead of lyrics, I poured that feeling into the
Fortelle.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb00
STRING: It was something I did almost unconsciously.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb28
STRING: [Chris] “...Ah.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb3e
STRING: Even though I'd played it so many times before, I
accidentally played a wrong note.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb54
STRING: My fingers were already tired, and once I became
conscious of the fact, my movements grew clumsy, as if
I were playing on board a ship.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xb74
STRING: Things weren't looking good, and right on cue, I heard
Grave's voice.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xba6
STRING: [Grave] “Stop playing, Chris Vertin.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xbbc
STRING: [Chris] “...Yes.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xbd2
STRING: Grave came and stood in front of me, literally looking
down at me.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xbf0
STRING: [Grave] “The wrong notes are none of my concern.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xc06
STRING: [Chris] “...Huh?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xc24
STRING: [Grave] “They can always be fixed with practice. What
you still don't seem to understand is my instruction to
play with your heart.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xc44
STRING: He closed his eyes, as if recalling the song I'd been
playing, then opened his eyes again.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xc62
STRING: [Grave] “A song about parting, or the thoughts of a
lover.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xc78
STRING: [Chris] “Y-Yes.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xc96
STRING: [Grave] “Your mistakes caused you to lose focus. You
played well up until that point.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xcb6
STRING: It took me a few moments to realize that he meant that
as a compliment.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xccc
STRING: And what came after that realization was a sense of
awe.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xcd8
STRING: He didn't seem to be paying attention, but in fact he
knew everything.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xcf6
STRING: [Grave] “You wrote that yourself. Enough of that, from
now on, you will play songs composed by others.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd24
STRING: With that, he returned to his seat.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd30
STRING: I still felt no respect for him, but I had to recognize his
considerable talent.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd46
STRING: Consciously, I decided to play all the songs I'd learned
at school.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd86
STRING: Time went by in a relaxed manner after that.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xd92
STRING: Over and over again, my performance was interrupted
by Grave for some kind of instruction.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xda8
STRING: If it was a famous piece, he provided details such as the
life story of the composer, and the circumstances of its
writing.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xdbe
STRING: By that time, my resistance had all but vanished, and I
listened obediently.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xdd4
STRING: Some songs took more than twenty minutes to get
through.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xde0
STRING: And I had absolutely no more songs to play, so I started
playing Lise's song, almost unconsciously.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xdfe
STRING: Somehow, I sensed that it would've been wiser not to.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xe14
STRING: But I couldn't stop halfway, so I just kept playing.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xe2a
STRING: [Chris] “...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xe40
STRING: I guess it really was a bad idea, or maybe Grave noticed
that my heart wasn't in it, but he stopped me with a
single phrase.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xe7c
STRING: [Grave] “Where did you learn that song?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xe94
STRING: It was the former, or so that question suggested, at
least

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xea0
STRING: I couldn't tell a lie, so I answered truthfully even though
I knew it was a bad idea.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xeb6
STRING: [Chris] “...I heard it from a friend.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xed4
STRING: [Grave] “...Is that so? Chris Vertin. So you were the one.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xeea
STRING: [Chris] “...What do you mean?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf00
STRING: Grave continued speaking with perfect composure.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf14
STRING: [Grave] “Don't get involved in matters that don't
concern you. Your future depends on it. Do I make
myself clear?”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf34
STRING: [Chris] “...”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf52
STRING: [Grave] “The lecture ends here. Pack up at once and
leave.”

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf80
STRING: Without saying anything else, he returned to his seat.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xf8c
STRING: From that point on, he didn't look over once, and I was
completely ignored.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xfa2
STRING: His attitude suggested he thought it impossible for his
orders to be disobeyed.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xfb8
STRING: I had no choice but to pack up my Fortelle and leave
the lecture room.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0xffe
STRING: I turned to look at the other student as I left, but his
seat was empty, he must've been dismissed at some
point.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1014
STRING: After I stepped outside, I finally noticed how much time
had actually passed.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x102a
STRING: The sky was already dark, this week's lecture had gone
on longer than last week's.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1036
STRING: I felt both physically and mentally exhausted.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1042
STRING: Part of it was the fact that Grave had found out about
me and Lise, but more importantly, I had played the
Fortelle continuously for a very long time.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x1062
STRING: With all my heart.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x106e
STRING: For that reason alone, my mind had become numb from
fatigue, and I couldn't even think of Lise.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x10cc
STRING: When I got home, I didn't even have the strength to dry
myself with a towel, and simply collapsed into bed.

COMMANDS.LABEL: 0x10e2
STRING: The only thing I said to Phorni was a request to be
woken up tomorrow morning, and before I heard her
reply, I was fast asleep.
